text: Bottle. Hazy golden, offwhite lace. Nice applepeel aroma. Medium light body, foamy mouthfeel. Light apple cider/spritz, a hint leather, fresh, very pleasant
Herb apfeliger Geruch. Recht süß, spritzig frisch, trockener Mittelteil. Etwas pappig. 10/11/11/11/9/11
75cl bottle. Pours almost clear pale golden colour with a small white head. Aroma of dry apples, ripe apples, stones, some grapes. Taste of sweet apples, semi dry, a bit sour, okay!

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2017 Bottle, thanks anstei! Hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma is natural red apples, wood, some funk. Taste is red apples, vanilla, some wood. Semi-dry tannic finish. Medium to fizzy carbonation. Excellent and flavourful Cider, and very drinkable at the same time.

Golden with medium white head. Aroma is champagne and pear, some flour, sour stuff. Taste is fresh sour carbonation with sweet and sour apple juice. Slight tanins in the finish. Very fizzy on the tongue. Not bad.

(bottle, danke stefan!) slightly hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of heavy cobwebs and assorted botanicals, very dusty, with some notes of apple pie with custard, melted wax and yeast. flavour is mostly apple juice and custard, very sweet, with some light phenolics, a touch of green olives and a semi-dry apple finish. light- to medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

2016 edition. 7.1% abv. Bottle from Tipsy in Brooklyn.

Stemless wine glass. Opaque honey body. Big champagne-y foam-y sizzle & crash. 

Smells of skin, soil, mushy apples & a little funk.

Softly sweet upfront, mild, juicy, browned & faintly tart. Minerally, with lots of drying skin. Faint funk, but it airs out after a bit.

Tiny, soft, microbreaded carbonation. Slightly thick. Lacking some acid, but as a whole, wonderfully made.
user_location: FT: Stale Polotmavý in Queens, New York, USA

text: Bottle. Pours clear pale yellow, hints of a light cloud. Beautiful and round throughout, with a light but crisp carbonation, a fruity sweetness that harmonizes well and a semi-dry lightness that is refreshing without losing tastes or flavours. Highly recommended!

Style et résumé:  Cidre suisse. 
Comment: Merci Patrick. Bouteille 2014.
Portrait: Une robe jaune très pétillante. Un nez de pomme, quoi dautre ! Une touche détable est aussi perceptible. Une bouche piquante avec des pommes. Agréable.
Note:  7+/10
Sweet cider nose, maybe delicate spiciness. Juicy start, then dryish towards the end, bit dusty. Well balanced cider, good for breakfast.
Bottle - Nice fleshy Apple and musty skin. Clearish gold with a decent white head. Funky, light sulphur and peel. Dry and funky, very good.

750mL bottle, pours a hazy pale golden with a small white head. Aroma is very effervescent, with lots of champagne, light white wine and lightly sweet crisp apple skins. Flavour is complex, with loads of champagne, medium sweetness and white wine. Finishes with some funk and light sweetness. High carbonation, but it works beautifully. Excellent.

Vulcain Transparente 2014. Cidre qui présente une tête blanche. Un nez de pommes diverses avec des nuances campagnardes qui ne sont pas très présentes en bouche. En fait, le sucre naturel des pommes est bien évident. Effervescence naturelle. Finale plutôt douce que demi-sèche. Facile à boire. Un cidre qui fait un travail très honnête. Bon sans être exceptionnel.

pours cloudy very light but almost glowing golden with a rather large white head offering some retention and lacing. lightly tart apples, pears and small yellow fruits; soft underlying bretts - touch of smoke unfortunately; wood with distressed tannins; hint of sweetness - candied ginger and medium toasted spicy honey; lots of chalk, other minerals. bright to moderate carbonation, light body; semi-dry or semi-sweet - depending on how you feel - woodsy-spicy finish. felt a tad too sugary for what i wanted at the moment, but eh! definitely a farmhouse character. very nice swiss rustic cider.

Bottle shared. Clear gold pour with rather tenacious creamy white head. Aroma is juicy, fruity apples, mild barnyard notes, very faint actually, light citrusy notes. Taste is quite sweet, juicy apple flavor, light fruity acidity. Palate is light bodied, fluffy, semi-sweet. Very easy drinking and approachable cider.

Bottle (750 ml) shared at tasting. Clear golden with a medium white head leaving little lacing. Aroma is bright and fresh with juicy apples, hints of tropical fruits, mild herbal notes and oak spiciness. Taste is a well dosed mix of apples sweetness, moderate herbal astringency, mild acidity as well as a tiny bit of oak spiciness and vanilla. Light to medium body, but never watery. Lively carbonation that tickles the tongue a bit. Nice and bright apples finish. Moderately dry. Great balance and drinkability. I really like the juiciness and the rustic character. Lovely refined cider.

Pours a clear golden with a long lasting foamy white head that even leaves some lacing! Nose is of apples (flesh) of course but also light sulfur and farmy aromas. Not as intense as some of the French stuff (Dupont, Cannon and others Im sure), though, so Im sure I could serve that one to "normal" people. Light brett leather. Taste is gently tart and lightly sweet. Cider-centric and not really wild. Drying tannic finish. Body is medium and carbonation moderately high and fitting. A solid sparkling farmhouse cider!
